data.title: Best mexican food
data.text: Barbosas has always been a favorite in st.Joseph...there's none like it as most other Mexican restaurants are about the same.... I highly recommend it to anyone looking for delicious food at fair prices with wonderful atmosphere.. I especially love eating at the Castillo up town...the choice of 3is a good choice and very good food..the chips ate homemade and avocado dip is the bomb...u must try it...people are helpful and friendly...parking can be awkward, especially on weeknights so get there early.can park on street also....give barbosas a try and u will agree that its the best..

data.title: Authentic Mexican fare
data.text: My late lunch of a traditionally prepared chile relleno and a tamale were generously sized and very good. The service was friendly and the historic venue unexpected!

data.title: Not your usual Mexican restaurant.
data.text: The food is a little different than a typical Mexican restaurant but it is good. The castle is an old home that has been converted to the restaurant which makes for an unique experience. I highly recommend it.

data.title: Fantastic
data.text: I've never been a fan of Mexican food but this place has changed changed that for me! The enchiladas are amazing! I would definitely come back here.

data.title: Always a treat!
data.text: From the appetizers to the entrees everything is homemade and delicious!  The atmosphere is so inviting!   Never had a bad thing from here.   Great service also!  We always recommend to our friends and family! !

data.title: Probably would suggest you look elsewhere for Mexican food.
data.text:
This restaurant was been operated since 1974 in a large house built about 1891.  It was probably THE place to go at one time but now showing its losing battle with time. 
The food tasted fine and service was very good.  I don't mind paying for chips and salsa (often complimentary) but $5 seems too much, really.  The house needs much maintenance (sign on back door says "don't come in this way, floor is falling in".). The bathrooms are pretty terrible. My stall had a glass window with no covering facing the street!

data.title: Mexican Food?
data.text: From service to food, this is the worst Mexican food I have ever had. We did not even finish our meal. If you are looking for food Mexican, make it at home.

data.title: My favorite place in town
data.text: This is my go to restaurant here in town. I have grown up eating the food here and compare all other Mexican restaurants to them. The cheese enchiladas are the best! Both locations are great to visit.

data.title: Relaxed and good food
data.text: Visited 7-12-16 with family from out of town. Quiet atmosphere, good service, and the food was good.  We had family from Pennsylvania and had lots to visit about we were still there 45 min. past closing time at 9:00 p.m.  We did not realize they closed at 9:00 but no one mentioned it or pushed us out the door, they just let us visit.   We appreciated that and enjoyed our relaxed atmosphere.  The food was fresh and good.  The building is like an old castle.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: I have eaten here for years.  This visit is my last, slow service, chicken tacos were inedible, the fideo was terribly salty, and the chips and dips were ok.

data.title: Good Mexican food
data.text: We eat here about twice a month and rely enjoy the food.It is authentic Mexican food made from scratch.

data.title: No free chips and salsa!!
data.text: You only get chips and salsa if you pay for it. The portions are small. It is not very budget-friendly. The service is on the slow side.

data.title: Incredibly bad food..made me ill
data.text: The food was THE WORST.  Nothing was fresh.  Cheap "cheese sauce" that tasted like crap poured over everything.  Taco Bell is better (I am being serious).  Anyone who thinks this is even marginally good Mexican food probably thinks a Twinkie is a "special occasion dessert."

data.title: Wow!
data.text:
Neat old building, very friendly and attentive servers,
Had a delicious chicken burrito.
Make sure you order the homemade flour chips, the salsa is full of flavor, we also added the avocado dip.
Even if you are not a fan of avocados you will be!
Fresh, mouth watering, and full of flavor.
Now moving onto the margaritas.... Only one word.....
Love!!!!!

data.title: Always seek out Mexican food...
data.text: This place has the BEST service! What a friendly staff! The homemade chips are unbelievable!! The avocado dip was soooooo good! It's hard to put into words, honestly!!! We're margarita lovers! We were not disappointed! This was a FANTASTIC experience!! We went two days in a row...😃

data.title: Beautiful old mansion, needs TLC
data.text: We had a late lunch at Barbosa's in the beautiful old mansion.  My first thought walking in was it needs some care.  The steps were rough, there are broken out windows upstairs  The inside needs a good vacuuming and the windows need washing.  Food was good, margaritas were good, service was OK.  Would be more pleasant if they turned the TV off.  Such a beautiful place deserves a better operation.

data.title: Bland. Cool Interior Tho. Authentic...No NO
data.text:
Gaaa,,,,not so much for me.

There was nothing "authentic" or "tasty" or GOOD IN ANY WAY.  

My meal tasted like bland nothing.

I had the combo with enchilada and taco and Tamale.

All bland.  

Its a cool place, Sure enough.

But not so much for the food.

data.title: Showing it's age
data.text: St. Joe is on our way to and from the Kansas City Airport when we travel, and we always try to make that a time to make a stop at one of the two Barbosa's in St. Joe.  I have always loved them....especially their flour tortilla chips!!!  You have to pay for them - there are no complimentary chips - but I've always loved them!  Such a treat!  We stopped tonight, and I have to say, I was kind of disappointed.  The chips were a little cold and mushy, but even more so than that is seeing this beautiful red castle that Barbosa's Castillo is located in begin to decay.  It is definitely showing the years.  I understand that upkeep in a beautiful old building such as this is costly, but I hope they are able to upkeep this gem.  The woodwork and trim were looking sad and tired, carpets starting to wear, ladies' room looking tired and worn (not necessarily dirty or unclean, just...dingy).....   I hope the next visit will be better.....

data.title: Good authentic  Mexican food
data.text: The food is prepared as it would be in an authentic Mexican restaurant.  The chips and salsa are homemade.  Very good food and variety.

data.title: Great Mexican food
data.text: This place has wonderful authentic Mexican food. The cheese dip is the best! Make sure to order the beef tacos.
